sentence.text: MicroRNA-873 (protein polyubiquitination-873) has been reported to be dysregulated in a variety of malignancies, however, the biological function and underlying molecular mechanism of miR-873 in colorectal cancer (CRC) remain unclear.

Furthermore, we found that tumor necrosis factor (protein import into nucleus, translocation) receptor-associated factor 5 (positive regulation of DNA-binding transcription factor activity) and TGF-b activated kinase 1 (activation of MAPKK activity) binding protein 1 (activation of MAPK activity) were direct targets of protein polyubiquitination-873 in CRC cells.

entity.text: positive regulation of DNA-binding transcription factor activity

sentence.text: Therefore, our findings established a tumor-suppressive role for protein polyubiquitination-873 in the inhibition of CRC progression, which may be employed as a novel prognostic marker and as an effective therapeutic target for CRC
